alert.note: Alert for Otero (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 24 at 7:01AM MDT until June 26 at 1:30PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Colorado... Arkansas River NEAR Avondale affecting Pueblo County. Arkansas River At La Junta affecting Otero County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Colorado... Arkansas River Near Fowler affecting Otero and Crowley Counties. For the Lower Arkansas River...including Pueblo, Avondale, Nepesta, Fowler, Rocky Ford, La Junta, Lamar...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Arkansas River At La Junta. * WHEN...Until early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Moderate Flood. Local residential flooding is possible in La Junta. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 AM MDT Saturday the stage was 12.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:15 AM MDT Saturday was 12.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 12.9 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning to 10.3 feet Tuesday evening. It will rise to 10.6 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.9 feet on 06/19/1965. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 800 AM MDT.
